title: Senior Account Manager
content:
Cashmere Agency is a lifestyle marketing collective comprised of creative minds from the worlds of entertainment, advertising, and new media. We build authentic campaigns, pieced together by a creative mix of marketing and public relations strategies that resonate with today’s ever-evolving audience. Our client base includes a number of TV networks, motion picture studios, major recording artists, tech companies, and top-tier brands. 
Cashmere Agency is seeking a talented and thoughtful Senior Account Manager, Social to join our team. A senior account manager at Cashmere is a proven expert in organic social media marketing for major brands—who is skilled at owning and executing on large and small client relationships alike. They have the sole responsibility for the day-to-day running of the social account(s) to which they are assigned and all assigned projects as a part of that account(s).
The senior account manager will strive to be a master of the process so they know what happens next and 5 steps ahead, enabling them to predict where the process will go and avoid issues/embrace opportunities. The senior account manager should strive to be a master of the client’s business, building on expertise in the competitive landscape to support their understanding of the process. The account manager should set client expectations on all projects that they work on, leading client and work to be ahead of them. The senior account manager should start to manage internal stakeholders, setting their expectations and elevating any issues/opportunities so they can be addressed. All of these skills should be deployed to ensure that the account moves forward day-to-day, meeting deadlines and fulfilling client/brand/internal asks every day on time and on budget, delivering operational excellence. 
Delivering on this includes:

Ensuring the team is moving to deliver on the client’s expectations 
Mentoring the Coordinator on the business
Ensuring conference reports go out in a timely fashion
Ensuring status documents are updated and accurate 

Responsibilities:

Become a steward of the client’s business and brand
Accountable as a day-to-day contact for clients, with exceptional, proactive communication and organization skills
Collaborate and liaise with social directors, social strategists, and social coordinators, as well as interfacing heavily with the creative and production department—and other internal departments—as required to build deep client partnerships and deliver ongoing client value
Play a central role in the execution of innovative, thoughtful, culture-first social media campaigns that solve client business challenges through creative content-driven storytellingReview and ensure all campaigns and social content are in line with the client needs, briefs, and creative direction, while ensuring that all creative meets both the strategic and business goals for the client; provide approvals and feedback on key initiatives, presentations, and work output
Responsible for keeping extensive and organized notes and records for clear, timely, and regular external and internal reporting on project statuses and pacing against projected KPIs
Knowledge of all client brand guidelines (legal, privacy, content, etc.) and ensure that all guidelines are adhered to
Develop full knowledge of all factors (internal, external and competitive) affecting the Client's marketing goals and plans as well as full knowledge of the client's current business situation
Communicate frequently with brand and partner agencies, managing client requests and exceeding expectations
Handle multiple project assignments within tight deadlines and see a project through from start to finish with minimal guidance

Requirements: 

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Communication, Marketing, Advertising, or related field of study
3+ years of organic social account management experience 
Ability to work independently and with a team in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing entrepreneurial environment
Attention to detail, ability to multitask and prioritize, and strong organizational skills
Resourceful with strong problem-solving skills
Must have strong people management skills - able to positively lead a team and influence others
Must balance high-priority, long-term projects with short-term, immediate deadlines
Experience in leveraging timelines, workbacks, and production schedules to set up social + creative projects and drive success for them
Excellent presentation and communication skills, with experience presenting to leadership
A strong understanding of data and how to leverage insights to optimize social content
Familiarity with native social analytics and insights tools—including but not limited to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, Tik Tok, YouTube
Familiarity with 3rd-party social listening and digital measurement a plus (Sprinklr)
Strong proficiency in the Google Suite: Docs, Sheets, Slides, etc. 
Confidence and skill handling clients 

Media.Monks has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what Media.Monks may pay for the position at the time of posting. Media.Monks may ultimately pay more or less than the posted compensation range. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on job-related factors, but not based on a candidate’s sex or any other protected status.
Salary range
$100K — $110K USD
#LI-DM1
Cashmere’s core values are:

Own the work. Elevate each other.
Seek to understand. Speak with intent.
Spark Something. Challenge everything.
Make room. Make change.
Set the standard. Be undeniably dope.

Cashmere is an Equal Opportunity Employer. 
 
If you would like to become a part of one of the most influential, Culture agencies, then apply today! 
 
**Sorry, we are not accepting referrals from staffing and executive search agencies.About Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
Disclaimer: 


Responsible for resourcing and implementing security controls for your teams processes and systems


Responsible that all your personnel apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy

demographic_questions.description:
Media.Monks does not  discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, age, gender identity and expression, sexual identity, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide demographic information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.

As a reminder, answering these questions is entirely voluntary. Your responses will remain confidential and intended solely for the purpose of improving our hiring process; and will not, in any way, be associated with your specific application or be used in the hiring decision.
